text:
He pondered the nature of crime. 

“Not a crime,” he told himself. 

His will and reason felt strong. 

But preparation was absent. 

As he reached the staircase, doubt crept in. 

He peeked into the landlady’s kitchen. 

Nastasya stood there, hanging linen. 

She turned, eyes wide. 

“Why are you here?” she asked, surprised. 

His heart raced. 

Plans unraveled. 

He was not ready.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist grapples with the moral implications of his planned crime, believing his reasoning will remain intact, but is ultimately thrown off by an unexpected encounter.
